featureDesc: Success in battle increases your aggression.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, each time you have a successful attack against an opponent, you may increase your Ticker value by +1.

featureDesc: The whirl of battle loosens your inhibitions and strengthens your tolerance to pain.
featureBenDesc: While Engraged, you gain +2d6 temporary Hit Points.
featureNote: Temporary Hit Points are always lost first. If you are no longer Enraged, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from this Feature and all such related Features.

featureDesc: The intoxication of battle compels you to seek out more combat.
featureBenDesc: As an Immediate action while Enraged, if you fatally wound or destroy your primary opponent you may choose to make an additional attack at your full Melee attack modifier against any one other secondary opponent within 5’ of your Reach.

featureDesc: Your attacks are vicious and difficult to defeat.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter while Enraged, you may choose to re-roll one Combat Check against an opponent.  This Advantage can be used immediately after an otherwise failed attack has been resolved.
featureNote: You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You have committed violent acts in battle, and you liked it.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, your Ticker value is increased by your Madness Point value. Your Ticker is immediately reduced by the same amount if you are no longer Enraged or unable to participate in Combat for on full round.

featureDesc: Your rage in battle is especially violent.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, your Ticker value is increased by your Madness Point value. Your Battle Rage now lasts 1d4+1 rounds longer. Once per day, if you dispatch or destroy an opponent while using Battle Rage, you may enter into a Violent Rage. Violent Rage lasts for number of rounds equal to 1 + your Madness Points. During Violent Rage, your Combat Check roll increases by +1d4. When Violent Rage ends, you may return to your previous Enraged state as long as you have remaining rounds and still have opponents within Reach of 1 Pace. At the end of any Encounter in which you use Violent Rage, you become Exhausted and cannot become Enraged again until you have had at least an hour of Full Rest.

featureDesc: Your pain turns to anger and that anger strengthens you.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you suffer any Combat damage from an opponent using a melee weapon, you may deal +2 points of additional damage on your next successful melee attack roll against that opponent.

featureDesc: Your increased rage strengthens you.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, you now instead gain +3d6 temporary Hit Points.

featureDesc: You desire to crush your enemies and spill their blood.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you fatally wound or destroy your primary opponent you gain a +1d4 bonus to your next Combat Check roll.

featureDesc: Your attacks are even more vicious and difficult to defeat.
featureBenDesc: You may now use your Overwhelming Strike once per Encounter for each opponent that you face.
featureNote: You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You enjoy the carnage and violence that you bring to a fight.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, for each consecutive round that you succeed at a Melee attack, you deal a temporary cumulative +1 point of additional damage on each of the following successful attacks.
featureNote: If you are no longer Enraged, or if you fail at a Combat Check roll, you lose all accumulated additional damage from this Feature.

featureDesc: You are the first to draw blood.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if your Turn is first in a given round, you may automatically deal 1d4+5 points of damage to any one new opponent that you have not yeat dealt damage to during the Encounter.

featureDesc: Your rage in battle is especially violent.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. Your Battle Rage now lasts until the end of the Encounter, or until you are no longer able to be Enraged. You may enter Violent Rage once per Encounter now instead of once per day and it lasts for 1d4+Madness points. Once per day, if you suffer at least 10 points of lethal damage while in a Violent Rage, you may enter into a Blood Rage. Once per day, if you suffer at least 10 points of lethal damage while in a Violent Rage, you may enter into a Blood Rage. During Blood Rage, your Combat Check roll increases by +2d4. When Blood Rage ends, you may return to your previous Enraged state as long as you have remaining rounds and still have opponents within Reach of 1 Pace.

featureDesc: You are gripped by battle madness.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, add your Madness Points as a bonus to your Modifier Value. Any time you enter combat, you automatically enter Battle Rage.

featureDesc: You may cross the field of battle to attack an opponent.
featureBenDesc: You may make a move action as part of your Full Round Enraged state Attack Action.

featureDesc: Your madness for combat pushes you against all pain.
featureBenDesc: Permanently add your Madness points to your Hit Point Total.

featureDesc: You continue to grow stronger in your rage.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, you now instead gain +3d8 temporary Hit Points.

featureDesc: You desire to crush your enemies and spill their blood.
featureBenDesc: If you fatally wound or destroy your primary opponent while in melee you may choose to make an additional attack against any other opponent within Reach of one Pace. If you drop your second opponent during the same round, you may continue to take additional such attacks so long as you continue to drop your opponents.

featureDesc: Battle Madness drives your desire to destroy your opponents.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, for each consecutive round that succeed at a Melee attack, you gain a temporary cumulative +1 bonus your Modifier value.
featureNote: If you are no longer Enraged, or if you fail at a Combat Check roll, you lose all accumulated additional damage from this Feature.

featureDesc: You like to pulverize things.
featureBenDesc: While using your Favored Bashing Weapon during a melee attack, you may add your Spiritual Ability die type as a bonus to additional damage on each successful melee attack roll.

featureDesc: You like to cut things.
featureBenDesc: While using your Favored Slashing Weapon during a melee attack, you may add your Spiritual Ability die type as a bonus to additional damage on each successful melee attack roll.

featureDesc: You like to stab things.
featureBenDesc: While using your Favored Impaling Weapon during a melee attack, you may add your Spiritual Ability die type as a bonus to additional damage on each successful melee attack roll.

featureDesc: You like to thrash things.
featureBenDesc: While using your Favored Lashing Weapon during a melee attack, you may add your Spiritual Ability die type as a bonus to additional damage on each successful melee attack roll.

featureDesc: You bring bloody vengence down upon those who dare to shed your blood.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you suffer any damage from an opponent using a melee weapon, you may deal your Madness Points as additional retribution damage on your next successful Melee attack against the offending opponent. After your next successful melee attack against this opponent, you may now deal +2 points of additional damage on each successful melee attack against that opponent until that opponent is destroyed or otherwise unable to continue combat.

featureDesc: Watching your enemies fall motivates you to greater feats of bloodletting.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, each opponent that you Fatally Wound will die at the start of your next Turn instead of 10 rounds later.

featureDesc: Your rage in battle is a thing of true madness.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. Your Battle Rage is now always a Violent Rage. You may enter Blood Rage once per Encounter now instead of once per day and it lasts for 1d4+Madness points. Your Rage bonus die type for each Enraged state increase to d6. While Enraged, you continue to attack opponents each round that you are able to until all opponents are dispatched. If there aren’t any opponents left you will begin to attack adjacent allies unless you succeed at a Mental action Recall check against 3d6 or until you are not able to attack.

featureDesc: You must attack even if you need to cross the field of battle.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you dispatch all adjacent opponents, you must attack the next nearest opponent within your Move radius.  If there is no opponent within this radius, you must attack the nearest ally.

featureDesc: The lust for battle makes you deadly, but blind to the dangers at hand.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, you may make a Critical Hit attempt during a Standard Attack Action and gain a free result of  “6” to any one die result for a successful Critical Hit attempt. All opponents rolling against you while you are Enraged gain an automatic “6” to one die roll on any successful Critical Hit attempt made against you.

featureDesc: Your rage blinds you to damage that would kill a lesser warrior.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you suffer damage that reduces you to 0 Hit Points or less, you must continue to fight without any Modifiers for the next 10 rounds or until all combat has ended.
featureNote: If 10 rounds have passed and you remain in combat, you will die on the following round if you do not receive immediate medical attention. If combat ends within those 10 rounds, you must receive immediate medical attention within one round or else you will die of your wounds.

featureDesc: While Enraged, in addition to attacking your primary opponent, your Combat Check roll is applied against all participants (opponents and allies included) within Reach.
Your foes fall beneath your vicious blows.
featureBenDesc: You may now use your Overwhelming Strike once per round.
featureNote: You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You revel in the spray of blood spurting from the gaping wounds of your enemies.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged and using your Chosen Slashing Weapon, each of your successful melee attacks deals bleed damage to your opponents.  A successful attack reduces your opponent’s Health by a cumulative 1d4 points of damage per round until the wound is staunched or healed.

featureDesc: You live to make holes in living creatures.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged and using your Chosen Impaling Weapon, each of your successful melee attacks deals bleed damage to your opponents.  A successful attack reduces your opponent’s Health by a cumulative 1d4 points of damage per round until the wound is staunched or healed.

featureDesc: The sound of breaking bones and squashed flesh is music to your ears.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged and using your Chosen Bashing Weapon, each of your successful melee attacks deals bleed damage to your opponents.  A successful attack reduces your opponent’s Health by a cumulative 1d4 points of damage per round until the wound is staunched or healed.

featureDesc: You revel in the pained screams of your victims.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged and using your Chosen Lashing Weapon, each of your successful melee attacks deals bleed damage to your opponents.  A successful attack reduces your opponent’s Health by a cumulative 1d4 points of damage per round until the wound is staunched or healed.

featureDesc: You are transcendent within rage and all of the world is painted red.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. Whenever you become ‘Enraged’, there is now always a ‘Blood Rage’ and lasts until the end of the Encounter. Your Rage bonus is now always 3d8. While Enraged, you continue to attack opponents each round that you are able to until all opponents are dispatched. If there aren’t any opponents left you will begin to attack adjacent allies unless or until you are rendered immobile, become unconscious, or die.

featureDesc: Your rage becomes more deadly when you are on death’s door.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if your Current Hit Point total drops to 5 or below, you deal twice the amount of all damage on a successful melee attack.

featureDesc: You are Death Incarnate. You revel in the death screams of your victims.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. Your Madness Transcends mere rage.  You may now choose to become Enraged at will. While Enraged, all attacks are treated as Critical Hit attempts.
